main event: A civilian reported a sighting of a star-shaped object resembling a star, round, and without sound, which gradually turned red over a 40-minute observation period.
interesting points: The object was sighted for approximately 40 minutes, turning red at the end of the observation.
The observer estimated the object's brightness and position in the sky based on its appearance in relation to their auto windshield.
The object appeared to be stationary for approximately 30 minutes before turning brilliant red and disappearing.
The sighting took place five miles west of Utica, New York, on the New York State Thruway.
The observer, a 28-year-old cost estimator, was traveling from five miles south of Trenton, New York, to approximately ten miles east of Syracuse, New York, via the New York State Thruway.
